stanza.line: That thou art blamed shall not be thy (a)defect(/a)
For slander's mark was ever yet the (b)fair(/b)
A crow that flies in heaven's sweetest (b)air(/b)
So thou be good slander doth but (c)approve(/c)
Thy worth the greater being wooed of (d)time(/d)
For canker vice the sweetest buds doth (c)love(/c)
And thou present'st a pure unstained (d)prime(/d)
Thou hast passed by the ambush of young (e)days(/e)
Either not assailed or victor being (f)charged(/f)
Yet this thy praise cannot be so thy (e)praise(/e)
If some suspect of ill masked not thy (g)show(/g)
Then thou alone kingdoms of hearts shouldst (g)owe(/g)
